intro: Physaria saximontana var. dentata, commonly known as the toothed bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky habitats, such as cliffs and slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar structural features. The variety dentata is distinguished by its finely toothed leaf margins, contributing to its unique appearance.
